heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 13 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.9°C), outside temperature (down 2.6°C), and inside temperature (down 1.8°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 223 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 356 m) and inside temperature (up 2.4°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 222.7m lower than yesterday, 5.8m higher than the past week, 356.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 1039m and a high of 2260m, averaging 1243.6m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the air will feel dry and calm and still conditions are expected. Chance of light rain, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and the light is absent. Little change in the weather.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
